parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate. It discusses public opinion regarding the EU and NATO based on a Eurobarometer survey.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content addresses general public opinion on the EU and NATO, not targeting specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to share the results of a public opinion poll regarding trust in the EU and NATO. While this information might indirectly influence voters' opinions, the post does not explicitly advocate for or against any particular candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents factual information from a reputable source (Eurobarometer) and links to a news article for further details. This aligns with journalistic practices of informing the public.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express personal opinions but rather presents factual data from a public opinion survey.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1135929967963034</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post presents results from a Eurobarometer survey on public trust in the EU and NATO.  It does not mention any parliamentary candidates or parties, nor does it explicitly encourage voting for or against any specific candidate. The post's aim is to inform the public about the survey results, which is consistent with journalistic practices. While the information presented might indirectly influence voters' perceptions, it does not constitute direct electoral propaganda as defined by Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015. The post does not violate Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 because it does not meet the criteria of electoral propaganda.  It lacks a direct reference to a candidate (a), its objective is not primarily electoral (c), and it falls within the bounds of journalistic reporting (d).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>European Media Connections</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
